Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
you need to view KMD as an ecosystem, already over 50 chains with dPoW and countless others in dev stage without dPoW. https://dexstats.info/explorers.php
each chain is independent and precisely "sharded", overall capacity is over 10,000 tx per second (assuming 200 tx/sec for 50 chains)
this is live for over a year, it is easily scalable to an arbitrary number of chains (tx/sec or shard equivalents), without the issues that a sharded solution needs.
i will not make KMD into a tax collecting coin

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: by default most all the chains in the ecosystem will end up using KMD as a currency of exchange with people in the ecosystem. there are other use cases, but i think the biggest one will simply be more and more people using KMD to transact with, as their chain is a komodod runtime fork. so the more chains in the ecosystem, with the more people on those teams, the more usage KMD will get

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of course, this is not the taxation model that most people seem to like

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i was on the other side of this equation when I was developing on NXT. and sure enough, the rules were changed and the taxes went up so high, the dapps became nonviable

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD needs to be the tax free platform, i think it is the only one. KMD does have the 5% active user rewards, which is more than most other platform coins. also the atomicDEX dexfees will all be converted into KMD for distribution, so that creates buying pressure. We also have in testing defi chains, that will lock KMD in order to be able to use them

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the single chain taxation model "works" if your goal is to make the most demand in the short term, until the chain bogs down and becomes nonviable to be used. eventually, only low frequency/high value transactions that dont mind paying $5 will be left

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: THAT is not how blockchains will scale to the mass market

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: regardless of the market, i will not support KMD adding taxes to use

Author: Flint#6435
Content: @jl777c  if the main place of using KMD is DEX on which we may not see liquidity for a very long time, then the same BNB takes big steps to use and trade their token! Just who will explain to people why it is more profitable for them to use kmd for bidding than bnb or btc? ETH has already considered the issue of economic abstraction, but here we have it in its purest form - probably the only thing that has not yet made the last holders to sell is 5% reward! But the same Qtum does the same and the trading volume is 10 times higher! There are many innovations and there is no marketing - except for rare interviews that are watched only by KMD cipher banks and scammers! Initially, we at least had a stake on confidentiality but removed it by transferring it to pirates who might die due to the competition of stronger confidential coins - they simply do not give listing on exchanges and a significant trump card is lost - but it remained with competitors HORIZEN and others! MetalX also agreed with regulators and launch the exchange! What about us? The Komodo project itself, as an exchange and infrastructure, is good and good as a sidechain, but the KMD token itself - what does it do better than the top 10 cryptocurrencies? Without an influx of investment, competitors will eat us up and we will repeat the fate of OBITS - where everything also started well, but in the end the project almost died - although the technologies there are also excellent! If in the Komodo ecosystem it is equally possible to use more liquid and growing assets, then why should tokens be used by institutional?
